pageContext.description: (approximate septum),Well preserved. Cast marks. Sharp edge, signs of much re-grinding. Decoration below stop is worn.
pageContext.patina: Dark brown and green patina mottled, showing golden bronze. Glossy green on septum and in middle.
pageContext.associations: Found with another at Bryn Shop. SE of Castle Bryn Amburg
pageContext.publications: Shrops. Arch. Trans. 1927, 4th Series, XI, Misc.
pageContext.collection: Private Collection,1926,Dr. T. W. Graves, Bucknell R.S.O.,Shropshire,Bought from William Morgan, Felindre Rads. Aged 75, the son of the finder.
pageContext.site: England, shropshire,bettws-y-crwyn,about 1856,when digging holes for fencing posts (depth unknown)
pageContext.remarks: The other implement was larger but shape is forgotten. Present location unknown.
